modules.name: COM1001 Introduction to Software Engineering
modules.description: This module served as an introduction to general concepts and skills that are needed for a software engineering project (for example, different development methodologies such as agile & waterfall, usage of git for version control, and the ruby programming language). The module finished with a group project, in which I led a team of 7 computer science students to develop a twitter-like application for a fictional company, using Sinatra.

modules.name: COM1002 Foundations of Computer Science
modules.description: This module served to introduce mathematical concepts that are foundational to the field of computer science, such as propositional & predicate logic, basic statistics (such as gaussian/poisson distributions), and calculations using modulus.

modules.name: COM1003 Java Programming
modules.description: This module introduced me to programming using Java. It also helped me to deepen my understanding of object-oriented programming principles that I had developed during my A-Level computer science course. There was also an emphasis on producing readable code, which definitely helped me to develop my ability to produce high quality, maintainable code.

modules.name: COM1005 Machines and Intelligence
modules.description: This module provided me with an overview of how artificial intelligence has developed over time, and how it has transformed from relatively simple (by today's standards) robots such as Shakey, into what we know it as nowadays. The module also helped me to expand on my A-Level knowledge of python and pathfinding algorithms such as Dijkstra's Algorithm and the A* Algorithm.

modules.name: COM1009 Introduction to Algorithms and Data Structures
